title: Antonio Segura/Ana Miralles: Eva Medusa (1991|TPB-1280|Dragonz)
description:
Overviews:

  <a href=" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonio_Segura#Awards" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonio_Segura#Awards</a>

  <a href=" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ana_Miralles" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ana_Miralles</a>



Contains:

   Eva Medusa (ADULT) (1991) (TPB-1280) (Dragonz)



   Another erotic work, but in quite a different league from the large majority of
   those I posted previously, as clearly demonstrated by the fact that it won a
   major mainstream comics award as "best comic" and for "best script" - and the
   artwork certainly looks award-worthy as well, to me at least. In terms of genre,
   this is principally a historical drama, set in 1920s Brazil, featuring various
   supernatural and sexual themes, voodoo and incest prominently among them.

   This is a scanlation release of the omnibus edition, collecting what was
   originally published in three volumes. The first of those has been published in
   English via Heavy Metal, and there is a Pudgy release of that edition, but this
   one is of significantly better quality, and the text of that first third has been
   lifted straight from the professional translation anyway, so there's no downside
   whatsoever to this version, as far as I'm able to discern. :)
